intro: Saxifraga biflora var. chanousiana, commonly known as the Chanousian saxifrage, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Saxifragaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces numerous white or pinkish flowers during the summer months, which are arranged in a dense inflorescence. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and requires a cool, humid environment to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
